snippet: A leading theater organization is developing proposals to stop selling the medallion-topped Tony Awards each year to investors who help finance Tony-winning Broadway shows.
abstract: American Theater Wing, which helps oversee Tony Awards, is developing proposals to stop selling awards to scores of investors who help finance winning Broadway shows; investors are currently invited to buy a Tony for $2,500 if their musicals or plays win in the four show categories; group is concerned that sales cheapen integrity of award and is considering alternate award to sell to investors.
lead_paragraph: A leading theater organization is developing proposals to stop selling the medallion-topped Tony Awards each year to investors who help finance Tony-winning Broadway shows.

headline.main: A Tony for the Mantel? Maybe Not
headline.print_headline: A Tony for the Mantel? Maybe Not
